channel.title: Ack, How do I get myself String Owner

item.title: Ack, How do I get myself String Owner
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Yep, as long as you have an end “}” that will work.

                if (playerRights == 3) {
                    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "The owner "
                            + playerName + " has logged in!";
                }

Or by Player name.

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("name"))
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "(message) " + playername + " has logged in!  ";
}
skiller noob1:

You guys need to learn how to make better jokes…

Is that supposed to be an offense to me?

Read full topic
item.source: Ack, How do I get myself String Owner

Is that correct?[/quote]
Perfect

item.title: Ack, How do I get myself String Owner

item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Owner-Fugh:

Eugh! Listen I have the custom messages somewhere I set the name to it, but it won’t show me logging in as the ‘Owner Owner’.

Here, just did this for Hustla-Scape.

                if (playerRights == 3) {
                    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "The owner and coder, "
                            + playerName + " has logged in!";
                }

item.title: Ack, How do I get myself String Owner
item.dc:creator: @_Java6 `Java
item.description:
@_Java6 wrote:

Owner-Fugh:

well, I want them to be the string owner when the log in so it says something like, The Main Owner “Name” has logged in. I have it somewhere. But when I change their rights to ‘3’ it says Co-Owner “Name” has logged in. >_>

You have to set a custom login message for that, or change the playerRights == 3 one.
I suggest you just make a custom login message though, because there will be no co owner login message if you change it to and owner message.

Read full topic

item.title: Ack, How do I get myself String Owner

item.description:
@Owner-Fugh wrote:

well, I ran into a problem with my server, I have ‘Owner Fugh’ As the string owner and I want to change it, but I just can’t understand why It’s not working >_<. I have this code: [code]

public void newWelc() {
String owner = “1 Perfected 1”;
[/code]

Could someone assist me on making the String owner someone else?

Read full topic
